author: jdotpz
content:
#More security, more learning Node.JS
I have just started learning Node.JS with my friend and co-worker [Pomax](http://pomax.github.io) teaching me.  One of my first tasks was to add HSTS and X-Frame-Options headers to all of our infrastructure.
I started with the first NodeJS app I wrote, [http_helper](https://github.com/mozilla/http_helper), and [immediately added HSTS, X-Frame-Options headers, as well as IEXSS protection](https://github.com/mozilla/http_helper/commit/3a08f68f16a7111367b3b2d5ca9699b14d1897da).  I used [Helmet](https://www.npmjs.org/package/helmet) to do it, and it was dead simple.
I've started using [conditionals to be able to turn](https://github.com/mozilla-appmaker/appmaker/pull/1333/files) these on/off in my pull requests to Mozilla repos.
